Detailed Description

cvmx_mhbw::_ab::_slt::_fat_err_int

These registers record fatal errors. There is one register for each job slot (SLT(0..2)) in each HAB (AB(0..3)) in each MHAB (MHBW(0..19)). Note that registers only exist for the number of HABs and slots in each specific MHAB.

Fatal errors include: * ECC double-bit errors on SMEM accesses. * errors when accessing memory. * ECC double-bit errors in internal HAB memories. * HAB-specific fatal errors.

When an error occurs, the job tag is recorded in one of the following registers:

_ Error on read DMA: MHBW()_AB()_SLT()_RD_FAT_JTAG

_ Error on write DMA: MHBW()_AB()_SLT()_WR_FAT_JTAG

_ Other fatal errors: MHBW()_AB()_SLT()_CP_FAT_JTAG

When an error occurs, the MHAB sends a fatal error message to PSM which then triggers an interrupt, if enabled. In addition, the MHBW sends the command specified by <MHBW()_FATAL_ERROR_JCE_W1,MHBW()_FATAL_ERROR_JCE_W0> to the PSM.
